intro: Arracacia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapan arracacha, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly in the regions of Chiapas and neighboring areas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its root system is notable for containing compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. However, it is less commonly cultivated compared to other members of its family.
